ab.note: The end of this word is tucked under the line.
The last part of this word is tucked under the line.

There is a marginal note, but it has been smudged out. The corresponding mark in the text has also been smudged out. It appears that τα αγια was originally in the text, with το αγιον in the margin, but a later corrector erased the correction in the margin and replaced the reading in the text with it.
The last part of this word is tucked under the line.
The -ον- in this word looks somewhat cramped, which could indicate that -ε- was originally written here; however, there is no sign of an underlying text or an erasure.
This word is tucked under the line.
The marginal reading seems to be intended to change the phrase τοτε αποκριθεις to αποκριθεις δε, probably for liturgical purposes.
This word is tucked under the line.
This correction was probably meant to follow the next word.
The last part of this word is tucked under the line.
Folios 62 and 69 have been swapped in the manuscript (so this folio is actually found around the beginning of Mark), but their original numbering is correct.
